intro: Gouania mauritiana subsp. pannigera, commonly known as the Mauritius goania, is a flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and distinctive, palmate leaves. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
